intro: Roettlera verbeniflos, commonly known as the Florida rottlera, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that bloom in the spring. The plant typically grows in moist, wooded areas and has opposite, ovate leaves with serrated edges. Its botanical features include a woody stem and small, elliptical fruits that contain seeds. Roettlera verbeniflos is often found in wetlands and is an important component of the local flora in its native habitat.
